author: tantnd
title: LetsWork platform on Cardano
description: Most of the job search sites today are based on the mechanism: Hirer-Broker- Freelancer. The broker in the middle receives a commission

f6_assessments.q0:
the proposed group gave a very reasonable reason that ; Currently, traditional job search websites are increasing operating costs and hindering stakeholders. because they are operated according to Employer - Broker - Employee steps, so the team proposes pioneering a solution to optimize those problems for stakeholders and reduce damage to users ,

using the two languages ​​Marlowe and Plutus, to create a smart coin for employers and employees eliminating unnecessary brokers,
* however I would like to correct this statement of the proposal " we use Marlowe and Plutus to build backend logic functions (Create, Edit, Search, Invoice, Apply...) of website" as far as I know two languages ​​Marlowe and Plutus, will not support the direct editing of content in the smart contract, but can only delete and create a new contract and new conditions, near there are a lot of developers working on and finding a solution to this problem,
did the team raise two risks and provide solutions for them, I agree with the competitor risk, the team's solution is reasonable,
but I am not satisfied with the risk of personal conflicts, because the conditions provided to activate the contract through the processing of the original agreed content, may all be information off-chain. so in my opinion the team should research, and cooperate with information providers to integrate, about the data validator of the Oracle array. This will ensure correct security with the information provided for the smart contract to work.
besides all other arguments of the proposal were reasonable and understandable, the team identified the problem and provided parallel solutions to thoroughly solve the problem.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal tackles the need for a bridge to bridge the gap between developers who can help entrepreneurs who lack the necessary skills to effectively exploit the Cardano ecosystem's potential and entrepreneurs who do. It's true that there are several existing tools such as Upwork and Fiver which can help professionals hire freelancers who can get the required work done for them and they have already established their reputations amongst working professionals. But there is no way they can be made blockchain concentrated or tweaked to provide additional support just for Cardano projects. Hence on successful implementation of the project, the Cardano chain can become self-sufficient and independent of these external tools. Having suitable policies and regulations specific to blockchain aspects can provide more authority and control over the misusage of the tool. The detailed idea and the understanding of the risks and drawbacks involved show the team's extensive background research on the topic.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer gives the community a very detailed explanation of the Dapp and the team's precise plans for handling specific portions. The milestones are well spread across a timeline of 8 months with a clear set of goals for every 2-month interval. The team also provides an approach of systematic release for the Dapp, which adds points to the feasibility criteria. There is a very good possibility that the proposal will be accepted thanks to the well-described action plan and appropriate deliverables. There is also little debate about the team's level of experience given that they go by the well-known name of Nguyen, a widespread name in the Vietnamese community. The team put together has been a part of the community for a long time and the same can be seen with all the previous proposals they have submitted. Considering there is truth to the fact of having completed all the proposals from the previous rounds, there is very little doubt about the completion of the project. The budget also is plausible and justified for the amount of work that is involved in the development of the Dapp.
f6_assessments.q2: From the above section, it is pretty clear that this proposal has traits of being triumphant. Additionally, the proposal contains a wealth of data on potential KPIs that auditors can use to monitor the proposal's development. The action plan also includes metric objectives for every 2-months, which makes it easier to audit and monitor progress. Quantifiable metrics such as the number of participants approaching the Dapp, and the number of headhunters who are hiring through the Dapp could present a flavor of the Dapp's success. The open-source nature will make tracking the process of development over Git easy. Systematic release of the prototypes at regular intervals, release reports, and announcements make the community aware of the project's accomplishments. With all the evidence listed above, it will be quite easy to assess and audit the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem stated in the proposal corresponds to the challenge. Building the recruiting platform with the help of smart contracts on the Cardano blockchain would contribute to the sustainability of the Cardano community.

 As payments between employer and freelancer will be done in ADA, the number of wallets and transactions will increase automatically. 
No service fees will attract more users and promote awareness of the blockchain's benefits compared to centralized analogs.

The proposer considers 2 main risks and provides possible solutions. 
I find this step very briefly written as it doesn't fully explain the idea. How promotion of the platform only among blockchain members will help to overtake other competitors in the market? Why not promote it to a wider audience either?
As for personal conflicts of interest, I think it would be nice to get a bit more details too. For example, how can freelancers be secure to get paid for their work? How will it be regulated by smart contracts? More detailed explanation of the risk’s mitigation would clarify emerging community questions.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is in align with the challenge's objectives, has the potential to make a huge impact on the Cardano community in general, and offers a compelling reason for others to explore the Cardano universe. Many people who work as freelancers don't earn as much money as they should because it's difficult to obtain work or because the platforms charges too much. This solution is great and realistic, and it will make it easier for businesses to hire talented individuals. This proposal successfully addresses the challenge.
